title: Add Stop hooks for real-time Claude status detection
description:
Use Claude's Stop hook for real-time idle detection instead of current 30s threshold.

## Approach
1. Add Stop hook to ~/.claude/settings.json that writes status to a temp file
2. Hook command writes project cwd + timestamp when Claude finishes responding
3. meh claude reads these status files for instant idle detection

## Hook Config
```json
"Stop": [{
  "hooks": [{
    "type": "command",
    "command": "echo \"idle:$(pwd):\1765230654\" > ~/.claude/status/\$CLAUDE_SESSION_ID"
  }]
}]
```

## Benefits
- Real-time status (no 30s guess)
- More accurate than JSONL timestamp parsing
- Can add other hooks (SessionStart) for Working status
